revised_title: Industrial Electrochemistry: Organic Reactions via Electrochemically Generated Intermediates
tldr: This article discusses the potential of industrial electrochemistry in organic reactions using electrochemically generated intermediates. It highlights the advantages of using electrochemical methods for oxidation and reduction under mild conditions, leading to functional group transformations. The author emphasizes the importance of expanding the organic electrochemistry field and the need for more research in this area.
